subject: RE: [junit] Swingui TesterRunner can not call EJB?
msgSnippet: It s the classloader ... use the -noloading switch or use one of those JUnit.Properties thingies. ...
messageBody:
RE: [junit] Swingui TesterRunner can not call EJB?

It's the classloader ... use the -noloading switch or use one of those JUnit.Properties thingies.

    -----Original Message-----
    From:   Mathieu Gervais [SMTP:egoine_@...]
    Sent:   Friday, March 23, 2001 1:55 PM
    To:     junit@yahoogroups.com
    Subject:        Re: [junit] Swingui TesterRunner can not call EJB?

    Hi,

    We do unit testing of EJB with the swingui & a servletui with no
    problem.(vaj+ Websphere test env.).

    I don't think it has anything to do with junit itself. More like a classpath
    issue. Does the client code only has access to client-side classes (remote
    interfaces...) like it should? Is your classpath clean? JNDI? What is your
    app server? Old versions of stuff around?

    mathieu

    >From: peaceluck@...
    >Reply-To: junit@yahoogroups.com
    >To: junit@yahoogroups.com
    >Subject: [junit] Swingui TesterRunner can not call EJB?
    >Date: Fri, 23 Mar 2001 19:13:41 -0000
    >
    >We are trying to call EJB in our JUnit, it runs fine normally,
    >however, if we run it from the TesterRunner of swingui, the
    >PortableRemoteObject.narrow() method throws a ClassCastException.
    >
    >Anyone has experienced this problem?
    >
